result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa Marie Thorp

records.addlTxt:
No Abusive Contact with  A  S.T.  8/11/2008,  E.M.T  9/26/2013,  E.R.T. 9/26/2013 
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

9:02 AM Defendant Melissa Marie Thorp in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman (Special Appearance) appeared by video for Melissa Marie Thorp.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.    Court indicates Attny Chapman to be appointed to case.   Court enters NG Plea to Count 2 and 3.   State makes bond recommendation.  Attny Chapman no objection.   Court sets bond.  SIBS $2500  No Abusive Contact with  A  S.T.  8/11/2008,  E.M.T  9/26/2013,  E.R.T. 9/26/2013  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options. 

Through Attorney DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court sets preliminary hearing.     DEF to report to jail for fingerprints.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:45 am.
